intro: Rhexia graveolens, commonly known as Sweetshrub, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its fragrant, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Rhexia graveolens is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
